duties_responsibilities.duty: Responsible for all stages of the business intelligence development lifecycle, from understanding business objectives to designing and developing reports or dashboards.
Collaborates with business and technology departments to understand system data, validate data analysis, and provide support around data integration.
Monitors production systems for issues and resolves them independently or escalates for resolution.
Develops advanced knowledge of system capabilities, applications, and processes to function effectively as an educator and expert for system users.
Leads delivery of technical consulting and 24x7 support services and solutions with some management input.
Participates actively in routine meetings with department heads and/or superusers to identify, document, and prioritize their needs.
Provides assessment, coordination, documentation, release note review, testing, and implementation of programming, upgrade, and project requests.
Ensures compliance with regulatory guidelines, policies, and procedures, and provides system solutions in accordance with them.
Advocates user perspective and focuses on ensuring a comprehensive support plan and documentation.
Provides on-call coverage as scheduled and responds to support calls within designated times according to priority.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree from a recognized college or university with major course work in engineering, physics, computer sciences, math, information systems, statistics, or equivalent related experience. A minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in clinical, business, or other healthcare operational areas or 7 years with no degree. This position requires that the appropriate Epic certification be successfully obtained for a specific area of assigned responsibility within the first 90 days of employment.
